schemacrawler.schemacrawler

Class Identifiers

  • java.lang.Object
    • schemacrawler.schemacrawler.Identifiers

  • public final class Identifiers
extends Object
    Allows working with database object identifiers. All SQL 2003 keywords are considered identifiers. If a live connection is provided, a list of valid identifiers is obtained from the database server as well. Several utility methods for looking up and quoting and unquoting identifiers are provided.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Whether the identifier name is quoted

      • isReservedWord

        public boolean isReservedWord(String word)
        Checks if a given word is a reserved word. Searches are case-insensitive.
        Parameters:
        word - Word to check
        Returns:
        Whether the given word is reserved

      • isToBeQuoted

        public boolean isToBeQuoted(String name)
        Checks if a given identifier name needs to be quoted. It uses generalized rules which are common across the majority of databases.
        Parameters:
        name - Identifier name to check
        Returns:
        Whether the given name needs to be quoted

      • quoteName

        public String quoteName(NamedObject namedObject)
        Quotes an identifier name using the identifier quote string. Does not quote the identifier name if quoting is not required, per generalized database rules.
        Parameters:
        namedObject - Object name to quote
        Returns:
        Identifier name after quoting it, or the original name if quoting is not required

      • quoteName

        public String quoteName(String name)
        Quotes an identifier name using the identifier quote string. Does not quote the identifier name if quoting is not required, per generalized database rules.
        Parameters:
        name - Identifier name to quote
        Returns:
        Identifier name after quoting it, or the original name if quoting is not required
